sen.j: 大日如来 (だいにちにょらい)、サンスクリット マハー・ヴァイローチャナ (mahaavairocana)は、密教において宇宙そのものと一体と考えられる汎神論的な如来（法身仏）の一尊。
sen.e: Dainichinyorai, mahaavairocana in Sanskrit, is a venerable entity of pantheistic Nyorai (the Dharmakaya Buddha), which is thought as a unit of universe itself in Mikkyo, Esoteric Buddhism.

Dainichinyorai (mahaavairocana in Sanskrit) is a venerable entity of the pantheistic Nyorai (the Dharmakaya Buddha), which is thought of as a unit of the universe itself in Mikkyo (Esoteric Buddhism).

Dainichinyorai (mahaavairocana in Sanskrit) is a venerable entity of the pantheistic Nyorai (the Dharmakaya Buddha), which is thought of as a unit of the universe itself in Mikkyo (Esoteric Buddhism).

sen.j: その光明が遍く照らすところから遍照、または大日という。
sen.e: Since its light shines all over the world, it is called Hensho or Dainichi.
Because its light shines over all the world, it is called Hensho or Dainichi.
Because its light shines over all the world, it is called Hensho or Dainichi.

sen.j: 三昧耶形は、金剛界曼荼羅では宝塔、胎蔵曼荼羅では五輪塔。
sen.e: Sanmayagyo Symbol is pagoda in Vajradhatumandala and Gorinto, five-ring pagoda in Garbha-mandala.
sen.cmt: 三昧耶形→http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110004644722/、金剛界曼荼羅→http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110002662145/、宝塔→Webster Online Dictionary、胎蔵曼荼羅→http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110002660727/、五輪塔→http://www.aisf.or.jp/%7Ejaanus/
sen.e: The symbol of Sanmayagyo is a pagoda in Vajradhatumandala and Gorinto, the five-ring pagoda in Garbha-mandala.
The symbol of Sanmayagyo is a pagoda in Vajradhatumandala and Gorinto, the five-ring pagoda in Garbha-mandala.

sen.j: 種子 (密教)（種字）は金剛界曼荼羅ではバン(vaM)、胎蔵曼荼羅ではアーク(aaH)またはア(a)。
sen.e: Shushi (Mikkyo) (Shuji) was vaM in Vajradhatumandala and aaH or a in Garbha-mandala.
Shushi (Mikkyo) (Shuji) was vaM in Vajradhatumandala and aaH or a in Garbha-mandala.
Shushi (Mikkyo) (Shuji) was vaM in Vajradhatumandala and aaH or a in Garbha-mandala.

sen.j: 大毘盧遮那成仏神変加持経（大日経）の教主であり、大日経の説く胎藏曼荼羅中台八葉院九尊の主である。
sen.e: It is hierarch of Daibirushanabutsu-Jimpenkaji-kyo Sutra (Dainichi-kyo Sutra) and is the master of Garbha-mandala the central eight-Petal Court, Chuudaiihachiyouin, which Dainichi-kyo Sutra describes.
sen.cmt: 大毘盧遮那成仏神変加持経→http://www.emuseum.jp/cgi/bunsyutu.cgi?SyoID=5&ID=w027&SubID=s182&Link=w027x006、大日経→Yahoo辞書、中台八葉院→http://www.aisf.or.jp/~jaanus/deta/f/fugen.htm
sen.e: It is a hierarchy of Daibirushanabutsu-Jimpenkaji-kyo Sutra (Dainichi-kyo Sutra) and is the master of Garbha-mandala (the central Eight-Petal Court, or Chuudaiihachiyouin), as described by the Dainichi-kyo sutra.

It is a hierarchy of Daibirushanabutsu-Jimpenkaji-kyo Sutra (Dainichi-kyo Sutra) and is the master of Garbha-mandala (the central Eight-Petal Court, or Chuudaiihachiyouin), as described by the Dainichi-kyo sutra.

sen.j: また金剛頂経の説く金剛界曼荼羅五智如来の中心。
sen.e: Besides, it is the center of Vajradhatumandala Gochi-nyorai (Five Wisdom nyorai, Tathagatas) which Kongocho-kyo Sutra describes.
Moreover, it's the center of Vajradhatumandala Gochi-nyorai (Five Wisdom nyorai, or Tathagatas), which the Kongocho-kyo sutra describes.
Moreover, it's the center of Vajradhatumandala Gochi-nyorai (Five Wisdom nyorai, or Tathagatas), which the Kongocho-kyo sutra describes.

sen.j: 空海の開いた真言宗において、究極的には修行者自身と一体化すべきものとして最も重要な仏陀である。
sen.e: In Shingon sect which was founded by Kukai, it is the most important Buddha with which a disciplinant should integrate ultimately.
sen.cmt: 真言宗→英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: In the Shingon sect, which was founded by Kukai, it is the most important Buddha with which a disciplinant should ultimately integrate.
In the Shingon sect, which was founded by Kukai, it is the most important Buddha with which a disciplinant should ultimately integrate.

sen.j: 不動明王は、密教の根本尊である大日如来の化身、あるいはその内証（内心の決意）を表現したものであると見なされている。
sen.e: Fudo Myoo is regarded as an incarnation of Dainichinyorai, a fundamental Buddha in Mikkyo or an expression of its inner determination.
Fudo Myoo is regarded as an incarnation of Dainichinyorai, a fundamental Buddha in Mikkyo or an expression of its inner determination.
Fudo Myoo is regarded as an incarnation of Dainichinyorai, a fundamental Buddha in Mikkyo or an expression of its inner determination.

sen.j: 後期密教を大幅に取り入れたチベット仏教でも、大日如来は五仏（五智如来）の中心として尊崇される。
sen.e: In Tibetan Buddhism which incorporates the latter part of Mikkyo greatly, Dainichinyorai is revered as the center of the Five Buddhas, gobutsu, (Gochi-nyorai) as well.
In Tibetan Buddhism, which greatly incorporates the latter part of Mikkyo, Dainichinyorai is revered as the center of the Five Buddhas (gobutsu) as well as Gochi-nyorai.
In Tibetan Buddhism, which greatly incorporates the latter part of Mikkyo, Dainichinyorai is revered as the center of the Five Buddhas (gobutsu) as well as Gochi-nyorai.

sen.j: チベット仏教では、宝飾品を身に纏わずに通常の如来の姿で表現されたり、あるいは多面仏として描かれることもある。
sen.e: In Tibetan Buddhism it is expressed as common Nyorai's figure without putting on jewelry or sometimes drawn as a Buddha who has many faces.
In Tibetan Buddhism it is commonly expressed as Nyorai's figure without jewelry or is sometimes drawn as a Buddha having many faces.
In Tibetan Buddhism it is commonly expressed as Nyorai's figure without jewelry or is sometimes drawn as a Buddha having many faces.

sen.j: 像形は、宝冠をはじめ瓔珞などの豪華な装身具を身に着けた、菩薩のような姿の坐像として表現される。
sen.e: The form of statue is expressed by the seated figure like Bosatsu, Bodhisattva, who puts on luxury accessory such as crown and Yoraku, a string of beads or lace-work used to decorate Buddhist statues and objects.

The form of statue is expressed by the seated figure like Bosatsu (Bodhisattva), who wears luxurious accessories such as a crown and a yoraku, a string of beads or lace-work used to decorate Buddhist statues and objects.

The form of statue is expressed by the seated figure like Bosatsu (Bodhisattva), who wears luxurious accessories such as a crown and a yoraku, a string of beads or lace-work used to decorate Buddhist statues and objects.

sen.j: これは古代インドの王族の姿を模したものである。
sen.e: This imitates the figure of ancient Indian royalty.
This imitates the figure of ancient Indian royalty.
This imitates the figure of ancient Indian royalty.

sen.j: 一般に如来は装身具を一切身に着けない薄衣の姿で表現されるが、大日如来は宇宙そのもの存在を装身具の如く身にまとった者として、特に王者の姿で表されるのである。
sen.e: Generally Nyorai is expressed as a lightly dressed figure without putting on any accessory, but Dainichinyorai is expressed especially as a monarch which puts on the existence of universe itself like accessory.
Generally, Nyorai is expressed as a lightly dressed figure free of any accessory, but Dainichinyorai is particularly expressed as a monarch that wears the existence of the universe like an accessory.
Generally, Nyorai is expressed as a lightly dressed figure free of any accessory, but Dainichinyorai is particularly expressed as a monarch that wears the existence of the universe like an accessory.

sen.j: 印相は、金剛界大日如来は智拳印を、胎蔵界大日如来は法界定印を結ぶ。
sen.e: The symbolic gesture by fingers of Vajradhatu Dainichinyorai is Chiken-in, the knowledge-fist mudra, and that of Garbhadhatu Dainichinyorai is Hokkai Join, Dharma-realm meditation mudra.
sen.cmt: 金剛界→http://en.bab.la/dictionary/english-japanese/Vajradhatu+Mandala.html、智拳印→http://www.aisf.or.jp/~jaanus/deta/c/chikenin.htm、胎蔵界→http://en.bab.la/dictionary/english-japanese/Vajradhatu+Mandala.html、法界定印→http://www.aisf.or.jp/~jaanus/deta/h/hokkaijouin.htm
sen.e: The symbolic gesture with the fingers of Vajradhatu Dainichinyorai is Chiken-in (the knowledge-fist mudra), and that of Garbhadhatu Dainichinyorai is Hokkai Join (the Dharma-realm meditation mudra).
The symbolic gesture with the fingers of Vajradhatu Dainichinyorai is Chiken-in (the knowledge-fist mudra), and that of Garbhadhatu Dainichinyorai is Hokkai Join (the Dharma-realm meditation mudra).

sen.j: アフラ・マズダー起源説について
sen.e: About a theory that Dainichinyorai originates from Ahura Mazda
sen.cmt: アフラ・マズダー→Yahoo辞書
sen.e: About the theory that Dainichinyorai originates from Ahura Mazda
About the theory that Dainichinyorai originates from Ahura Mazda

sen.j: 大日如来（摩訶毘盧遮那仏、マハー・ヴァイローチャナ）の成立の起源を、ゾロアスター教の善の最高神アフラ・マズダーに求める学説がある。
sen.e: There is a theory that Dainichinyorai (Makabirushanabutsu (Mahavairocana), mahaavairocana) originates from Ahura Mazda, the supreme god in Zoroastrianism.
sen.cmt: 摩訶毘盧遮那仏→http://www005.upp.so-net.ne.jp/houenji/page042.html、ゾロアスター教→英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: There is a theory that Dainichinyorai (Makabirushanabutsu (Mahavairocana), mahaavairocana) originates from Ahura Mazda, the supreme god in Zoroastrianism.
There is a theory that Dainichinyorai (Makabirushanabutsu (Mahavairocana), mahaavairocana) originates from Ahura Mazda, the supreme god in Zoroastrianism.

sen.j: 太陽の属性と智の属性、火を信奉することを根拠としているが、ゾロアスター教と密教は教義に大きな差がある。
sen.e: It is based on the attribution of the Sun and wisdom and the belief of fire, but there is a large disparity in dharma between Zoroastrianism and Mikkyo.
It is based on the attribution of the sun and wisdom and the belief of fire, but there is a large disparity in dharmas between Zoroastrianism and Mikkyo.
It is based on the attribution of the sun and wisdom and the belief of fire, but there is a large disparity in dharmas between Zoroastrianism and Mikkyo.

sen.j: そのアフラ・マズダーは、ミタンニ・ヒッタイトにおける契約の神ヴァルナを起源とする学説もある。
sen.e: There is another theory that Ahura Mazda originates from Varuna, a god of contract in Mitanni and Hittite.
sen.cmt: ミタンニ→Yahoo辞書、ヒッタイト→Yahoo辞書、ヴァルナ→http://www.geocities.co.jp/HeartLand/2935/t-zatu4.htm
sen.e: There is another theory that Ahura Mazda originates from Varuna, a god of contract in Mitanni and Hittite.
There is another theory that Ahura Mazda originates from Varuna, a god of contract in Mitanni and Hittite.

sen.j: この説は昔からヴァルナが光明神ミスラとのセットであること、彼がアスラであることを前提としているが、それ以外には主だった類似性は見られない。
sen.e: This theory assumes that Varuna was a pair of Mithra, a light god, since ancient times and that he was Asura, but there is no major similarity except that.
This theory assumes that Varuna was a pair of Mithra (a god of light) since ancient times and that he was Asura, but there is no other significant similarity.
This theory assumes that Varuna was a pair of Mithra (a god of light) since ancient times and that he was Asura, but there is no other significant similarity.

sen.j: また、大日如来をインド神話のアスラ神族の王ヴィローチャナに求める学説もある。
sen.e: In addition, there is the other theory that Dainichinyorai originates from Virocana, the king of Asura family in Indian myth.
Additionally, there is the theory that Dainichinyorai originates from Virocana, the king of the Asura family in Indian mythology.
Additionally, there is the theory that Dainichinyorai originates from Virocana, the king of the Asura family in Indian mythology.

sen.j: この名が華厳経の教主の毘盧遮那仏（ヴァイローチャナ）と類似することから、毘盧遮那仏から発展した大日如来とも同一視する学説もある。
sen.e: Moreover, the other theory considers it as a unit of Dainichinyorai who developed from Vairocana since this name is similar to Virocana, the hierarch of Kegon-kyo Sutra.
sen.cmt: 毘盧遮那仏（ヴァイローチャナ)→goo辞書
sen.e: Moreover, the other theory considers it to be a unit of Dainichinyorai that developed from Vairocana, since the name is similar to Virocana, the hierarchy of the Kegon-kyo sutra.
Moreover, the other theory considers it to be a unit of Dainichinyorai that developed from Vairocana, since the name is similar to Virocana, the hierarchy of the Kegon-kyo sutra.

sen.j: その説は、チャーンドギヤ・ウパニシャッドの説話を根拠としているようだ。
sen.e: It seems that the theory is based on the story of Chandogya Upanishad.
sen.cmt: チャーンドギヤ・ウパニシャッド→http://www.geocities.com/advaitavedant/chandogya.htm
sen.e: It seems that the theory is based on the story of Chandogya Upanishad.
It seems that the theory is based on the story of Chandogya Upanishad.

sen.j: ただ、インドの叙事詩「マハーバーラタ」では、ヴィローチャナとは太陽神のことであり、必ずしもヴィローチャナという言葉がアスラ王のみを意味するわけではない。
sen.e: However, in 'the Mahdbharata,' an epic poem of India Virocana means the sun god and not necessarily means only the King Asura.
However, in 'the Mahdbharata,' an epic poem of India, Virocana means the sun god but doesn't necessarily mean only King Asura.
However, in 'the Mahdbharata,' an epic poem of India, Virocana means the sun god but doesn't necessarily mean only King Asura.

sen.j: また、太陽神としてのヴィシュヌもこの異名を持つため、すぐさま起源とは言えない。
sen.e: Besides, since Visnu as the sun god has also this synonym, it does not be considered as the origin immediately.
Moreover, since Visnu as the sun god also has this synonym, it isn't considered to be the immediate origin.
Moreover, since Visnu as the sun god also has this synonym, it isn't considered to be the immediate origin.

sen.j: アスラ王やゾロアスター教の最高神を大日如来の起源とするこの説は、いまだに結論がついていない。
sen.e: This theory that Dainichinyorai originates from the King Asura and the supreme god of Zoroastrianism remains inconclusive.
This theory that Dainichinyorai originates from King Asura and the supreme god of Zoroastrianism remains inconclusive.
This theory that Dainichinyorai originates from King Asura and the supreme god of Zoroastrianism remains inconclusive.

sen.j: （実際、他の神々の起源も名の類似性以外に大きな根拠がないことが多い。）
sen.e: (Actually, the origins of the other gods are often invalid except similarity of names.)
(Actually, the origins of the other gods are often invalid except for the similarities among names.)
